summary: The 'Medicaid Improvement for Insular Areas Act of 2025' aims to eliminate the general Medicaid funding limitations (caps) for territories of the United States, including Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa, starting in fiscal year 2025. The bill amends sections of the Social Security Act to remove these funding restrictions and make conforming amendments. It directly addresses the financial constraints faced by these territories in providing healthcare services.
